alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Warren, southeastern Mercer, Henderson, central Des Moines and northeastern Lee Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 611 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Seaton to Denmark. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 35 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Seaton around 615 PM CDT. Little York around 620 PM CDT. West Burlington around 625 PM CDT. Burlington and Lake Warren around 630 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Carman, Gulf Port, North Henderson, Stronghurst, Biggsville and Raritan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Illinois...and southeastern Iowa.
